alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN COOK COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 228 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over the eastern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness near Sea Gull Lake, or 10 miles west of Gunflint Lake. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water in low-lying campsites within the Boundary Waters. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Alpine Lake and Sea Gull Lake through 315 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding of low-lying campsites and portage trails. Do not travel or camp in ponded or flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Anyone at a campground should seek shelter until this storm passes.
